While some spiral galaxies, such as those with lower apparent magnitudes, are indeed brighter than other types of galaxies, not all spiral galaxies possess this characteristic. **Answer:** The statement is incorrect because not all spiral galaxies have the least apparent magnitude; some may appear dimmer than other types of galaxies.
